meanings.definition: To roll or move heavily or noisily
meanings.sent1: The large truck trundled down the road, making a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The suitcase trundled down the stairs with a thud.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy bear trundled along, causing a ruckus in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds trundled across the sky, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: The boulder trundled down the hill, gaining speed with each roll.

meanings.sent1: The old dog trundled along the path, taking its time.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker trundled up the steep mountain, step by step.
meanings.sent3: The snail trundled across the garden, in no rush at all.
meanings.sent4: The heavy fog trundled in, enveloping the town in mist.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar trundled along the branch, munching on leaves as it went.

meanings.definition: To transport or carry in a wheeled vehicle
meanings.sent1: The delivery man trundled the packages to the door in his cart.
meanings.sent2: The children trundled their toys in the wagon to the park.
meanings.sent3: The farmer trundled the hay bales to the barn on his tractor.
meanings.sent4: The movers trundled the furniture carefully into the new house.
meanings.sent5: The porter trundled the luggage on the trolley to the hotel room.
